flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500*$.0.25=$125<<500*0.25=125>>125 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500*$.0.5=$205<<500*0.5=205>>205 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $125+$205=$330<<125+205=330>>330 total.
#### 330

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 250, not 205. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
